title: 10 burning questions about the 2025 Patriots ahead of their season opener
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots begin the Mike Vrabel era with a revamped roster, including Stefon Diggs and rookie left tackle Will Campbell.
Cornerback Christian Gonzalez's Week 1 appearance is uncertain due to a lingering hamstring injury.
Safety Jabrill Peppers was cut despite previous success, as Craig Woodson and Jaylinn Hawkins start in his place.

title: Did you follow the local news this week? Take our Greater Boston news quiz.
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Boston.com offers a quiz to test knowledge of current Greater Boston news stories.
The quiz is designed to keep readers informed on trending topics in the Greater Boston area.
Peter Chianca, Boston.com General Assignment Editor, has been with the site since 2019.

title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox place reliever Jordan Hicks on 15-day IL with a shoulder injury after struggling against the Guardians.
Hicks holds an 8.20 ERA over 21 appearances since joining the Red Sox in a trade involving Rafael Devers.
Lefty Chris Murphy is expected to join the team as a bullpen replacement during Hicks' absence.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Derrick White discusses upcoming challenges for the Boston Celtics with changes impacting the team's 2025-26 season.
Celtics traded Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis amid salary cap issues; Jayson Tatum sidelined with Achilles injury.
Despite uncertainties, Celtics aim to motivate as underdogs with Jaylen Brown, Derrick White leading the team.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington Police closed the investigation of a reported child approach, finding the claims by the 11-year-old boy unfounded.
The child reported being approached by a masked man in a vehicle on Waldo Road, but no evidence was found.
Police reviewed surveillance footage and conducted interviews but found insufficient evidence to proceed with the investigation.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica charged with assault, battery, and a civil rights violation in Cambridge.
Freeman allegedly brandished a hatchet and used his car to threaten pro-Palestinian protesters in Harvard Square.
CAIR-MA represents protester Fawaz Abusharkh, claiming Freeman struck him with a car door in the incident.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots rookie Will Campbell is listed as limited in practice with an ankle injury ahead of the season opener.
Christian Gonzalez has not practiced since July, and is unlikely to play against the Raiders due to a hamstring injury.
Defensive tackle Christian Barmore practiced with limited participation, returning from absence due to blood clots.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An invasive seaweed species, heterosiphonia japonica, is causing a strong odor at Good Harbor Beach, Gloucester.
Strong winds from Hurricane Erin brought large amounts of the seaweed ashore, which are now decomposing.
The seaweed first appeared in the East Coast in 2008 and has since spread from Nova Scotia to Long Island.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: An explosive device damaged an ATM at an Eastern Bank in Woburn on Thursday morning, police report.
FBI and State Police Bomb Squad are investigating the incident, which involved a suspected pipe bomb.
No injuries were reported, and the suspect remains at large with no current threat to public safety.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, was arrested in Canton for the murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester on May 3.
Police found Shakar Caterson shot near Blue Hill Avenue and he died at a hospital on May 3.
Evans faces charges including murder and firearm violations, and will be arraigned in Roxbury Municipal Court.
